intro: Varronia podocephala, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant yellow flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
